column9: This rule looks for the command execution on a Virtual Machine via the "RunCommand" feature. Adversaries may use this feature to execute commands via Powershell on the VM with system privileges. This action could also be part of regular activity, so check the legitimacy of the activity and tune the rule for known sources.

column9: *** RF Rule *** . This rule trigger alert when a new Microsoft Azure resource or resource group is deployed. These activities will be used to track and baseline the activities from unseen user/IP.

column3: class=ms_azure result=failure NOT srcipv4:$exclusions.global.srcipv4
column9: A high number of VM creations or deployment activities have been detected in Azure in a short period of time. This anomalous activity could be an indication of resource hijacking, which is a common technique used during crypto-mining campaigns, as an example. Cloud environments are often targeted due to the high potential of available resources, and as such this activity should be investigated further.

column1: MICROSOFT AZURE [Delete Network Security Group - Failure]
column3: class=ms_azure source=microsoft.network action:`networksecuritygroups` action:`delete` result:[`failure`,`failed`] NOT srcipv4:$exclusions.global.srcipv4
column9: Azure AD support pass-through authentication which allows an on-premise agent to handle logon requests. Attackers may abuse this feature to intercept credentials for Azure and Office 365 logons. This event is logged when a new pass-through agent is registered with Azure AD. If this fires, inspect the details of the event to ensure it was authorized.

column1: MICROSOFT AZURE [Delete Network Security Group - Success]
column3: class=ms_azure source=microsoft.network action:`networksecuritygroups` action:`delete` result:[`success`,`succeeded`] NOT srcipv4:$exclusions.global.srcipv4
column9: This rule looks for the creation or modification of an Azure resource. While this is typically not enough to alert on by itself, it is a sensitive operation that could be abused by attackers to dump hashes or extract other valuable information from the disk. This rule is disabled by default and should be viewed as a template for customers.
column10: microsoft,azure,cloud,snapshot,Defense Evasion,Modify Cloud Compute Infrastructure,T1578,Create Snapshot,T1578.001,md-info

column1: MICROSOFT AZURE [Advanced Threat Protection Settings Updated]
